Fields.DialogueText: We're under attack! Everyone, with me!
Anshinshite kudasai, Kanchou! We'll drive them back with the fury of a thousand suns!
@BATTLE
What a battle... We were lucky to get out of there unscathed.
Otsukaresamadeshita, Kanchou. It was your quick decision making that led us to this victory.
I can't take all the credit. It was your combat prowess that cemented our victory, Hōshō.
Your kind words are appreciated, Kanchou. Still, I must not become complacent. To tarnish my namesake would bring shame on all those who invested their time into seeing me set sail.

Fields.MenuText: The "Hō-ō" is a kind of mythological phoenix, if I'm not mistaken?

Fields.DialogueText: Atte imasu. I have been blessed with such an inspiring name and I must make sure to live up to it. I also very much enjoy the western interpretation of a bird that rises from its own ashes.

Fields.MenuText: I think you're doing just fine.

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatō gozaimasu, Kanchou. I am thrilled to be given this opportunity to prove myself useful to the war effort.

Fields.MenuText: Have you tarnished it before?

Fields.DialogueText: Not purposefully, of course. However, as you can see I have long outlived my glory days, and any faltered step could leave me spending the rest of my life in reserve.
Regardless, I look forward to working beside you in the coming months.
Kochirakoso.
Dismissed.
It feels great to be back in the field again! Or, should I say, ocean!

Fields.MenuText: Is it so necessary for you to prove yourself?

Fields.DialogueText: While I have seen battle on several occasions, my service history is significantly lacking when compared to other Kami... even those far younger.

Fields.MenuText: What is your history like?

Fields.DialogueText: I remember being caught in a typhoon and badly damaged  during my supportive endeavor during the Sino-Japanese war. Hontōni hazukashikatta, sono toki ni...

Fields.MenuText: You were in reserve for some time before you came into my care, if your file is to be trusted.

Fields.DialogueText: Sōdesu. I had resigned myself to a life in reserve but have been given this final chance to prove myself.
I'm sure, even if our next assignment backfires, you could rise from the proverbial ashes to fight another day.
I'm not so sure, Kanchou...
Hōshō...?
Even a Western phoenix only has so many regenerations before the spirit becomes unwilling to rise anew...
Should I fail to prove myself on this outing, I may very well not have the strength to revive once more...
*ALARM*
Then we'll have to make sure each battle we fight is a resounding victory!
Hai! Ganbarimasu!
@BATTLE
You wanted to see me, Kanchou?
Yes, please have a seat. I've received word of our next assignment and I thought you'd want to be the first to hear it.
Jya, onegaishimasu.
Several ships have been caught with their pants down. Instead of resupplying at a nearby port, they decided to save time and try and head for home.
Hai.
They were ambushed without enough to defend themselves with.
Are the crew still alive?
I'll say! They've been adrift somewhere upstream for days now fending off Morgana attacks left, right, and centre!
Sugoi desu!
However, their reserves won't last forever. Without someone to escort them back to shore, they won't make it another month.
Wakarimashita!
That's where we come in. We'll be convening with the stranded crew and ensuring their safe return. Sound good?
Hai!

Fields.MenuText: Now, I don't want you to push yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: The safety of my crew will always come before any notions of pride I might hold.

Fields.MenuText: Any questions?

Fields.DialogueText: Iie. Your explanation was perfectly clear!
Good.
Oh! Actually... Regarding the phrase "Caught with one's pants down." Is that a Western expression? It is rather amusing.
I'll... uh... look into it...

Fields.MenuText: I have high hopes for you.

Fields.DialogueText: And I will do my best to meet them!
*ALARM*
No rest for the wicked. Let's deal with these Morganas and make haste to the nearest port town to restock our supplies for the mission ahead.
Hai!
It's always nice to stretch your legs after a lengthy voyage, wouldn't you agree, Kanchou?
Feel free to wander as you will. Just make sure you're back in time for our departure.
What kind of scatterbrain do you take me for, Kanchou?! Of course, I won't let simple distractions keep me from... SORE WA NANDESUKA?!
What was that about simple distractions?
Kanchou, mite kudasai!
Looks to be an injured starling. It must have fallen out of that tree.
Yabai desu, Kanchou. Now that we've interacted with it, the mother won't return for fear of our scent.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure a cat will be along soon enough to put it out of its misery.

Fields.DialogueText: Hidosuginai? I'm all for letting the circle of life play out in nature, but I cannot ignore such cruelty on my doorstep.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe we could find a veterinarian in the area.

Fields.DialogueText: I doubt such a quaint port town has such a physician on call.

Fields.MenuText: It'll be fine.

Fields.DialogueText: You're not suggesting we leave it here writhing in agony, are you?!
*ALARM*
Did you hear that? We don't have time to be lollygagging around here.
Kanchou, I will not be able to effectively do battle against any enemy while this bird's fate rests unanswered in my subconscious.
Very well. Here. Wrap it in my jacket and bring it aboard ship.
Daijōbu desu ka?
It's your responsibility, though. An injured bird is for life, not just for Nenmatsu.
Arigatō gozaimasu, Kanchou! Zenbu makasete.
@BATTLE
Hōshō, we'll be heading out soon. Are you and that bird nearly ready to--
Tori.
You named it already...
To go through one's life without a proper name is a fate worse than death!

Fields.MenuText: Don't you think "Tori" is a bit too literal?

Fields.DialogueText: You may be right about that. I've never been good at naming things. That is why I am so appreciative to those who conducted my naming with such care.

Fields.MenuText: Have you always been so nurturing?

Fields.DialogueText: I would never describe myself as such. This kind of thing is obvious, is it not?

Fields.MenuText: Do names interest you that much?

Fields.DialogueText: Most Japanese names have a meaning attached to them. Depending on the kanji used to write them, even similar sounding names can hold wildly different meanings. Omoshirokunai?
Make sure you pick up any supplies that bird will need in the future. We can't afford to keep stopping unnecessarily. Time is of the essence.
After we make the necessary purchases, we should be ready to set sail again. Let's take care of any Morganas blocking our exit and make haste.
Hai, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
What a lovely sound.
Ah, Kanchou. Bikkurishimashita.
I didn't know you could play the flute.
You flatter me, Kanchou. This simple melody is infantile compared to the great musical masterpieces of my homeland.
What's the occasion?
Tori seemed to be distressed. No matter what I tried, he would not stop crying. Only when I play this melody does he simmer down.

Fields.MenuText: How lovely.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm unsure as to whether I should be happy that he enjoys my music or insulted that it sounds so similar to that of a screeching bird...

Fields.MenuText: How long have you been playing?

Fields.DialogueText: I only started recently. One of the crew brought it back from a mission and gave it to me as a souvenir. It seemed rude not to at least try to learn how to play.

Fields.MenuText: Why the flute?

Fields.DialogueText: It's the closest we can come to birdsong. I'd like to be able to play like that one day.
*ALARM*
How impudent to drown out such a vibrant melody. Let's teach these Morganas a lesson!
Hai, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
Ah, Kanchou. Could you pass me that bottle feeder? Tori's just woken up and I'm sure he's hungry.
The way you take care of that bird... You look just like a mother.
Are you calling me old...?

Fields.MenuText: I meant to say that I think you'd be a great mother.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, that means a lot, Kanchou. I've yet to consider such a possibility... but perhaps if I met the right person.

Fields.MenuText: Do others not mention your style?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm aware that I dress more traditionally than others. The phoenix by design is one rooted in femininity. At least when compared to the more masculine dragon. Hiryū-san wa kekko otokopoi desho ne?

Fields.MenuText: No, no, no! It's just this situation, plus your clothes, makes you look a little... homely!

Fields.DialogueText: Dig a deeper hole, Kanchou. It will make it even more difficult for anyone to discover your body after I'm finished with you.
*ALARM*
Morganas! Are you able to tear yourself away for a brief moment?
Mochiron, Kanchou. I must set an example for this little one. I cannot be lazy lest it rub off on Tori!
@BATTLE
Hōshō! Radio for you!
Hai~.
Try to make it quick, we have lots to do.
Moshi, moshi? Hai... hai... hai, wakarimashita. Funayūrei no koto? Jōhō takusan arimasu! Chotto matte kuda--
*BZZZZZZ*
Moshi, moshi?
Sorry for cutting you off there, Hōshō, but please tell me you weren't about to share privileged information.
Ah! Kizukimasendeshita!

Fields.MenuText: Could you try to be more stiff-lipped from now on?

Fields.DialogueText: Gomennasai, Kanchou. Kwantung Army intelligence always know how to extract information from me. My loyalty lies with you now. I need to remember that.

Fields.MenuText: Are you so closely tied with Kwantung Army intelligence?

Fields.DialogueText: More than most Belles it would seem. Akagi and I often fall out over my loyalty...

Fields.MenuText: Where does your loyalty lie?

Fields.DialogueText: My loyalty is split in so many directions. The Navy, Army intelligence, you...
*ALARM*
Let's say no more about it. We have company!
Hai!
@BATTLE
I just wanted to apologize again, Kanchou. Now that I have had time to reflect, it was incredibly dangerous for me to reveal any kind of information so lightly.
I believe I said to speak no more about it. So long as it doesn't happen again, I will not reprimand you.
I would never dare speak of this publicly, but... in my honest opinion, I see no happy ending for their Manchukuo project.

Fields.MenuText: What makes you say that?
Why must you keep it a secret?
You don't see even a glimmer of hope? That's not like you.

Fields.DialogueText: Fate is a powerful mistress, Kanchou. That alone will separate China from Japanese hegemony.
To speak such words against those in power would be mutinous, Kanchou!
Well, perhaps after a millenium or two the two nations could see eye to eye...
*ALARM*
Morganas! Let's deal with them quickly!
Hai, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
Can't wait.
Oh! Gomennasai, Kanchou. Sometimes I forget that the human lifespan is significantly shorter than that of a Kami.
We should be closing in on the stranded ships any second now...
I'm starting to wonder if they'll be all right...

Fields.MenuText: Any man brave enough to face a Morgana won't go down so easily.

Fields.DialogueText: Tasshikani. Hope is what separates us from those monsters. We cannot let that faint spark die out.

Fields.MenuText: They can't have drifted too far.

Fields.DialogueText: When lost or in peril, it's usually better to stay put and await rescue rather than attempt to escape by oneself.
We lost all transmission to the crew to inform them that help is on the way, so hopefully their basic survival instincts took over.

Fields.MenuText: Would you be all right in a similar situation?

Fields.DialogueText: I would like to think so. That's why I have not given up hope that these men are still alive and kicking.
Wait a second... I think I hear gunfire...
Kanchou, mite! In the distance!
That's our mark! They're surrounded! They can't have much firepower left, we must save them at once!
Hai! Full steam ahead!
@BATTLE
Is everyone all right?
We're fine thanks to your help. Our hope was just about to run out that someone may come to rescue us.
Where is your captain? I'm sure they'll have pivotal information concerning this sudden outburst of Morganas.
Truth be told, the Morganas you just took down were cannon fodder. The captain led most of the main fleet away from us in hopes that we could survive for longer.
Such courage in the face of danger!
I'm sure the captain would not have suggested such a plan without an escape route.
Still... We should chase after them at our earliest convenience.

Fields.MenuText: Which direction did they go?

Fields.DialogueText: If you continue straight, there is a small town. They headed off in that direction with the fleet in tow.

Fields.MenuText: Does the captain have any supplies?

Fields.DialogueText: We gave most of our ammunition to the captain in hopes they could survive for longer. They should be able to hold out for a short while at least.

Fields.MenuText: Are any of the crew injured?

Fields.DialogueText: A few cuts and bruises. Nothing a pint of sake won't fix.
What do you propose we do, Kanchou?
Should the incoming fleet prove to be so powerful, we'll need to resupply.
Agreed. We exhausted almost everything rescuing this crew.
We'll escort these sailors to the nearby town before making our way after the fleeing captain.
I spot several Funayūrei in the distance, Kanchou. They should act as a nice bread trail for us to find the captain - or the port town, at least.
Good. Anyone that can stand; with me! The rest of you focus on getting out of the way!
@BATTLE
We managed to reach the dock fairly uninterrupted.
It makes you wonder just how many Morganas our fleeing captain acted as bait for...
Jikan ga nai desu, Kanchou. We must return to the sea as soon as possible.
Thank you for all that you've done. We knew our captain might give his life for ours when we signed up. Still, if you manage to save him... we will be forever grateful.
Just focus on recovering for now. WHEN we save your captain, it will do him no good to return to a crew of beaten-up good-for-nothings!
We'll take our leave, then.
Kanchou, do you think we should see if any of the stranded crew wish to join us going forward? I'm sure those fit and healthy would be happy to help search for their captain.

Fields.MenuText: Spread the word that we're interested in recruiting them.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai, Kanchou!
Even if on a temporary basis, I wouldn't feel right siphoning someone else's crew. I'd feel doubly responsible if anything happened to them.
Wakarimashita.
Our Morgana trail is steadily growing thinner. At this rate, we'll have no hope of finding the captain. Let's load up and move out!
Hai!
@BATTLE
Just how far did this captain run...?
All we can do is keep a steady course with our eyes peeled on the horizon.
Dōzo, Kanchou.
What's this?
A small pendant meant to instill good luck. It may seem farcical, but a placebo is often enough to quell impending distress.

Fields.MenuText: A flower?

Fields.DialogueText: This is a lotus blossom. It's meant to inspire rebirth. I have a similar necklace of my own depicting a phoenix feather and an ouroboros serpent devouring its own tail.

Fields.MenuText: How many of these do you have?

Fields.DialogueText: More than I can remember. I couldn't tell you why they drifted into my life, but it seems like tempting fate to cast them into the waves.

Fields.MenuText: Are you so superstitious?

Fields.DialogueText: Not particularly. But it can't do any harm, can it?
Regardless of my personal beliefs, I appreciate the gesture.
*ALARM*
Although if that alarm is anything to go by, I'm unsure as to how lucky these items can be...
Jyōdan desho ka, Kanchou? How fortunate we are to be able to cut down the Funayūrei numbers!
@BATTLE
Well, I'll be damned...
Mite, mite! His first steps!
I'll admit, I was hesitant to bring this bird on board at first. However, seeing your dedication to its recovery has really been inspiring.
I wonder if he'll be able to fly soon.

Fields.MenuText: Just make sure you tie a string around its ankle.

Fields.DialogueText: Omoshirosō! It would be like walking a dog.

Fields.MenuText: Are you partial to all animals or only birds?

Fields.DialogueText: Jitsu wa, I don't have a preference for any animal that isn't mythical. However, I'll always be sure to care for an injured creature... be it a bird or a Ryukyu spiny rat.

Fields.MenuText: Were we an air force regiment, we could take to the skies and show him how it's done.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sure I can pull some strings with the IJAAF for an impromptu tour above the clouds!
*ALARM*
I won't tolerate any layabouts aboard my ship. As soon as Tori is strong enough to fly, we'll outfit him with a naval uniform and have him start pulling his weight!
I'm sure he'd be thrilled at the chance to face off against a Funayūrei! Let's lead by example, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, do you have any twigs or branches I could borrow?
Whatever for?
I've nearly finished a small habitat for Tori in my quarters. I thought it best for him to learn to fly in a safe environment where a sudden plummet will not land him in the ocean.
Uh... I may have some sticks stuck to my field uniform. I'll bring them through to your quarters after I--
DAME!
... Or not...?
*Ahem* Please allow me to collect them from you, Kanchou. You must be very busy. I would not want to trouble you with such a menial task.
Is there something in your room you're trying to hide?
Whatever gave you that idea? *whistle*
*ALARM*
You're a terrible liar, Hōshō. It's not in your nature to be so deceitful. After we deal with these Morganas, I would ask for your permission to see your quarters.
*Sigh* If you insist...
@BATTLE
Wow... I never would have expected... that.
Satisfied? Now you know my secret shame...
Your room was... an absolute mess!
Shh! Kanchou, please keep your voice down! No one must ever know!

Fields.MenuText: How did you let it get in such a state?

Fields.DialogueText: As you know, I try my hardest to maintain the utmost levels of cleanliness and formality. Keeping myself to such high standards can be awfully tiring. My room is a safe haven from that stress.

Fields.MenuText: Would you like me to help you clean it?

Fields.DialogueText: I fear that would defeat its purpose, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: How long has it been in such a sorry state?

Fields.DialogueText: For as long as I can remember... Demo, it is not without reason!
Well, so long as it does not interfere with your work, I see no reason to impose any rules for individual quarters.
Hontō desu ka? Yokatta desu. I was worried you would think less of me after seeing it.
To be frank, the idea of a pocket dimension in which rules need not apply does sound very appealing.
Jya, I will give you free passage through my quarters whenever things get to be too much for you.
Well, thank you very much. And don't worry - your secret is safe with me.
How many days has it been with no sign of our missing captain...
He must have dragged a lot of Morganas along with him to have to run constantly without the ability to turn and fight even a little.
Dōshio...

Fields.MenuText: We're searching blindly for him at this point.

Fields.DialogueText: As if searching for a needle in a haystack. Or, should I say, an anchor in the Pacific.

Fields.MenuText: No word from the radio?

Fields.DialogueText: Not a peep...

Fields.MenuText: No news is good news, I suppose.

Fields.DialogueText: While I am thankful not to have come across his ship's remains, this feeling of uneasiness is starting to weigh on me.
If only we could send out something to survey the area. Then we could at least know the direction we should be heading in.
Kanchou, that's it! We can send Tori to scout for the fleeing captain and lead us to him!
You'd have me stake the lives of this captain and his crew on the reconnaissance abilities of an injured starling?
Tori can do it, Kanchou. We've been practicing flight patterns in our room for sometime now.
I see no harm in sending the bird out to sea, but are you okay with such a thing? What if he never comes back?
Tori is a bird of war, Kanchou. I would never look down on him or question his resolve.
It looks as if we've drifted into Morgana territory. Let's take care of these enemies and ensure a safe flight path for Tori.
Hai!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Tori Daijōbu ka na...?
He seemed pretty energetic during takeoff.
I tried my best to explain the situation to him. I hope he could understand...

Fields.MenuText: Is it all animals you can converse with, or only birds?

Fields.DialogueText: Unfortunately, I possess no such powers. I merely willed my desires into him.

Fields.MenuText: This is all very biblical, don't you think?

Fields.DialogueText: Noah did something similar, if I recall correctly. The dove he sent out in search of land is solely responsible for the plentiful wildlife we see prosper today, according to some.

Fields.MenuText: All we can do now is wait.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not inherently impatient, but when someone's life is on the line, I can't help but be overwhelmed by anxiety.
*ALARM*
Morganas!
Hayaku, Kanchou! We can't let them intrude on Tori's search!
Agreed! Let's stop them here!
@BATTLE
Kanchou! Asoko ni! It's Tori!
I can't believe it! The son of a bird did it!
I'll fetch him some food - he must be starving! Please hear what he has to say, Kanchou!

Fields.MenuText: Did you find the captain?

Fields.DialogueText: *KEW KEW*
Uh...

Fields.MenuText: Which direction should we move?

Fields.DialogueText: *KEWWW*

Fields.MenuText: Are the crew alive and well?

Fields.DialogueText: *KEW*
Here, I brought some grain and water. What did he say, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: *KEW KEW*
*KEWWW*
*KEW*

Fields.DialogueText: Subarashii! He found the crew!
West! Our goal is to the west!
They're all alive! Still being chased but otherwise healthy!
Are you sure you can't speak to animals...?
No time to waste, Kanchou! Let's plot a course and take out any Morganas standing in our way!
I'll be sure to dig out a medal of honor for Tori after this mission is over and done with!
Did you hear that, Tori? The Kanchou has taken a shine to you! Otsukaresamadesu!
@BATTLE
In the distance! Look at all those Morganas!
I can't make out the captain's ship at all!
He must be doing battle in the eye of the storm.

Fields.MenuText: What determination.

Fields.DialogueText: It comes with the title, desu ne? You of all people should understand that, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: They won't last much longer against such a fleet.

Fields.DialogueText: We must intervene at once!

Fields.MenuText: Tori was right, after all!

Fields.DialogueText: I never doubted him for a second!
Quickly, now! That captain has been doing battle for days now and has yet to give in! Don't let him show us up!
@BATTLE
All those who are injured, please head to the infirmary aboard our ship! Food and water will be distributed to those in critical condition first!
Drink up, Captain. You've earned it.
*Gulp gulp* GWAH! I'd never let the crew see me falter, but I was starting to run out of hope near the end there. How on earth did you ever find us?

Fields.MenuText: Captain's intuition.
You have Hōshō to thank for that.
Let's just say a little birdie told me where you were.

Fields.DialogueText: Hnngh... Kanchou, dame desu ne! Tori ga hontōni ganbatta nanoni!
I can't take all the credit. It was thanks to Tori that we found you.
Your savior is currently resting up, but we'll be sure to pass along your gratitude!
I don't plan to look a gift horse in the mouth. However you managed it, you have our eternal thanks.
Iwanakute ii desu yo. We were just doing our--
This is no time for modesty, young lady. Any other captain would have written us off as dead. We've been given a second chance at life, and it's all thanks to you.
You don't need to go so far...
Moments ago, I thought my life was as good as over. Now, it feels almost as if I've been reborn!
We get that a lot around here, huh?
Kanchou...
Now, let's get you back to the port with the rest of your men! Leave any Morganas obstructing our path to us! Move out!
@BATTLE
There we are, safe and sound!
If I haven't said it enough, you have my eternal--
Captain!
Ha! Did you miss me, lad?
Captain... We're so sorry we couldn't--
Hold your tongue, lad! Save your blubbering for the afterlife. We can't lose face in front of our saviors now, can we?
Right!
We'll be off, then. Thank you again, young lady. We hope to accompany you again someday.
Lost for words?
Kandōshimasu.
Is there anything I can do to thank you?
Follow your heart, Kanchou. I'm sure you can think of something.

Fields.MenuText: That was a rhetorical question.

Fields.DialogueText: Eh?! I was only joking, Kanchou! Your words of praise are more than enough motivation!

Fields.MenuText: A bouquet of flowers it is!

Fields.DialogueText: Let's head back to the sea after resupplying the ship. We should receive our next orders any day now.
Hai! Leave any circling Funayūrei to me!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I'd offer to take you dancing, but-

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou? Isogashii desu ka?
I always have time for you. Come in.
I just wanted to let you know that Tori is in perfect health and fluttering about my room without a care in the world.
Is that so? Well, that is good news. We'll have to have a tiny uniform made up for him.
Actually, Kanchou, I think it's time we let him go.
Go?
A ship is no place for a bird. Tori deserves to soar above the clouds.

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure?

Fields.DialogueText: It's time he left the nest.

Fields.MenuText: Well, that is sad.

Fields.DialogueText: Un. It's the start of something new. This is Tori's second chance at life.

Fields.MenuText: Your enclosure is too small?

Fields.DialogueText: With the state of my room being as it is, there's barely enough room even for me!
I see. Then please send him my regards.
Kanchou!
Honestly... Do I really need to be there for his final moments?
I'm sure it would mean a lot to him.
Just to him...?
*ALARM*
Gomennasai, kikimasendeshita! Meet me on the deck later, okay?
@BATTLE
Could you say a few a words?
I really wouldn't know what to--
Onegai! I'm *sniff* not good with words.
*Sigh* When we first found Tori, I did not think much of him.
A beaten-down weakling on the verge of death. However, if proof is ever needed that rebirth is possible, then Tori can supply it in spades.
Ii desu ne...
As we send you out into the world, remember one thing. No matter how bad your history may look, live for the future.
Very subtle, Kanchou.
I thought so.
Any final thoughts?

Fields.MenuText: Good luck.
Come back and visit.

Fields.DialogueText: Ganbatte, Tori!
Un! I'll be very angry if I don't hear from you!

Fields.MenuText: I'm spent. How about you?

Fields.DialogueText: I think you've said everything I would and more!
Be free! Enjoy your new life!
That was beautiful, Kanchou.
He's heading straight past those encroaching Morganas. It seems he lives for danger. I like it!
@BATTLE
Let's ensure Tori can escape without trouble! It's about time we repay our debt to him!
Kanchou? You wanted to see me?
I did. Please, take a seat.
Okorimasuka?
Quite the opposite.
Wakarimasen.

Fields.MenuText: How was the mission?

Fields.DialogueText: It was successful. I'm sure we could have tidied up some of our pathing here and there, but as no lives were lost, I am satisfied.

Fields.MenuText: How are you feeling?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm content. No lives were lost during our mission, and that is always an end result I can be proud of.

Fields.MenuText: Did Tori inspire anything inside you?

Fields.DialogueText: To work even harder so as not be shown up by an animal? Thank you for reminding me of my own inadequacies...
No, no!
I'm not sure I understand what you're saying, Kanchou.
Hōshō, you have proven yourself more than useful this mission, have you not?
I'm not one to toot my own--
You are less like a phoenix yourself and more like a giver of phoenix powers onto others. Without your influence, both the fleet and the bird would have perished before meeting their full potential.
Sōdemonai, Kanchou...
If there is one thing I want you to take from this whole experience, it's that your life is worth something! This life; your so-called final life! You don't need to be reborn!
Kanchou...
Help others to rise from the ashes!
*ALARM*
Kanchou... Could you come with me to the deck. There is something I'd like to ask you after dealing with these Funayūrei.
Of course.
@BATTLE
These Morganas just won't quit!
Akiramenaide, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
That looks to be the last of them...
Sōdesune.
What exactly was it you wanted to speak to me about?
Ah! Ah...

Fields.MenuText: You've gone all red. Is something the matter?

Fields.DialogueText: Sonnani jiro jiro shinaide, Kanchou!

Fields.MenuText: You can tell me anything, you know that.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai! You're right.

Fields.MenuText: Speak up! I don't have all day!

Fields.DialogueText: It's rude to rush a lady, Kanchou!
I wanted to thank you for what you said before. As you know, I wanted to prove myself useful in the field of battle.
Yes, I know.
I'm not as destructive as some of the other Kami, nor as tactical. However, if I can be a beacon of hope that breathes new life into others who would otherwise perish, I can hold my head up high.
As you should!
You showed me that my life has meaning, Kanchou. You are responsible for my rebirth... And so, I wanted to ask you... will you allow a Kami past her prime to stand beside you?

Fields.MenuText: I can think of nothing I'd like more.
Only if you agree to never leave my side from now until eternity.

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatō gozaimasu, Kanchou!
Eien made...? That would make us betrothed to one another... Ah, nani iitendayo, watashi?!
Let us set sail, Hōshō. There are plenty more lives to save out there.
Hai, Kanchou!
